name: Fairfield Inn Portland/ Maine Mall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was quick and easy, very friendly staff. Even grabbed a package for me that I had sent to the hotel without me even asking for it. Lobby was designed kind of strangely, not wide open like most hotel lobby. Price was reasonable for the area, $79 plus tax for the night. We were issued the old style plastic pass keys with the holes in them, which had to be used for the elevator as well.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.disliked: — Not within walking distance of Maine Mall, even though it's called

reviews.text: Upon entering the room it was very clean and inviting. Beds were made up nicely and the bathroom was clean as well, water pressure in the shower was fine.
reviews.title: Solid overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was very plentiful, including a Jimmy Deans frozen breakfast sandwich to throw in the microwave. There was a variety of bread and bagels to toast as well as yogurt, fruit and a waffle maker.
reviews.title: A cheap little trick
Don't expect much
reviews.text: Hotel was in a good location, very close to the Christmas Tree Shops store, and just down the road from the Maine Mall. Lots of food choices just down the street around the mall, including a great Chinese Buffet restaurant. The Maine Mall is not within walking distance.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again, didn't have any problems. I gave it a rating of a 4 as a 2 star hotel, as stated by the Marriot website.
reviews.title: Marriott quality...not so much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a recent weekend get away in Portland Maine. Chose this hotel based on a special Marriott weekend special offer that made the price very attractive.
reviews.title: Fine Place to Stay in Portland

reviews.text: No issues at all with the hotel. It was a typical Fairfield Inn, nice enough rooms in good and clean condition. Bathroom clean. Decent limited continental breakfast.
reviews.title: Nice Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: Yes, the elevator is in sort of a weird locatiion but no a big deal.
reviews.title: Great staff, great perks

reviews.text: Location is close to Rte 95, the airport and the Maine Mall. Not close to downtown Portland - which is about 6 miles away.
reviews.title: Better than expected
Just ok
reviews.text: Would stay here again if price was favorable.

I have stayed at the Fairfield at least 5 times over the last 12-18 months. I am in the area frequently on business and this hotel is in close proximity to my clients. The Fairfield is a "budget" property, yet until recently it was a great value.
reviews.title: Things have changed

reviews.text: I generally don't complain and try to write positive reviews about my trips...however...there has been a lot of desk staff turnover and sales staff turnover at this hotel, which seems to support my theory that things have recently changed.
reviews.title: very nice hotel
Great night's sleep
reviews.text: My most recent stay was a total disaster from the minute I walked in. I asked (as I always do) for a quiet room. I was given a room next to the front desk, on the first floor, right in back of the main parking lot and major road. As soon as I realized where the room was, I asked if it could be changed. This seemed to annoy the staff. They offered a room "at the far end of the same hall", saying that there were no other options because they were full. I came to realize this was probably a punishment for my complaint. This room was even worse. It also abutted the main parking lot, but was also beside the side door that many guests use to access the hotel.

The constant noise from opening and closing of the door was very annoying. Even worse, this is the area where smokers congregate (the entire hotel is nonsmoking, so everyone has to go outside to smoke.) The smoke backed up into my room through the a/c system. Cleanliness (beyond the basic housekeeping) left a lot to be desired. The a/c vent and the bathroom fan were filthy. The carpet had a lot of "fuzzies" and other things that should have been picked up by a good vacuuming. There were stains on tables, the window has a big paint stain on the outside. The whole room looked like it needed a good, deep scrubbing, with stains and marks on the wallpaper and a lot of dust around the edges of the furniture (obviously never moved, just vacuumed around).
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price.

reviews.text: Since the room is on the first floor with bushes in front of the window, a variety of bugs congregated on my window on this warm fall day. In addition, the little gnats seemed to find their way in and were buzzing all around. My souvenirs of this trip are a bunch of little red spots from the bites...
reviews.title: Poor by Fairfield Inn Standards

reviews.text: My husband, teenage daughter, and I stopped over here on our way to a family gathering in Maine. I used Marriott rewards points for this visit. This property was about average compared to similar hotels I've stayed in. The room was clean and equipped with a fridge and microwave, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was clean, but the towels were thin and worn. It was a surprisingly cold night for July, so I asked for an extra blanket, but it never arrived. Fortunately we were able to warm the room up. Breakfast was just average, and some items were not replenished quickly enough for the amount of people who were there. We would recommend the Sebago Brewing Company for dinner, which is right around the corner. All in all, we appreciated the hotel's cleanliness, but it could be improved in other areas.
reviews.title: Adequate hotel conveniently located.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an AVERAGE Fairfield Inn. The staff seems to be friendly and helpful and things do "work" but my room was not up to all the usual Marriott standards, even for a Fairfield Inn. There was a free frige in the room which was great but much to our shocik we found leftovers from the previous guest still in the frige! ugh. The bathroom was OK; some slight wear and tear on the tub (missing a soap holder) and sink (cracks and brown stains.
reviews.title: Hard to believe they charge this much for a stay here...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet in the room worked fine for me; not slow at all. There was a free computer and printer in the lobby so I could print out things as well. Some fruit in the lobby and coffee/tea available 24 hrs for everyone.
reviews.title: Comfy, good breakfast, unreliable Internet access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm just surprised how much they charge for a room. I guess this entire area is pretty expensive for what you get...
reviews.title: Don't Expect Much And You Won't Be Dissapointed...

reviews.text: My husband, mother and I stayed here twice on the same trip, for a total of three nights. We were unable to access the Internet in our room 2 out of 4 times. The rooms and beds are comfortable. The deluxe continental breakfast buffet is plentiful and has good variety. The cheese cubes, deli meat slices and hard boiled eggs were not available every day, tho -- were we late? The front desk man on the first night was very friendly upon check-in, and referred us to Sebago Brewing Co. for late dining. Terrific! On the last day, another front desk person messed up by putting my elderly mother's freezer packs to keep her medication cool, in the fridge, not the freezer, overnight. Boy, were we surprised when we were about to fly home to California, and the ice packs were not frozen. The current front desk staff scrambled to help us with workarounds, and were very apologetic. We are grateful for their efforts. The medication seemed to stay cold until California later that night. I would consider a different hotel next time, only for the Internet access. I needed to check work email while on the road.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

aka: Fairfield Inn Portland/ Maine Mall Hotel
description: Our completely renovated hotel in South Portland is only two miles from Portlaind International Jetport (PWM) and 1/2 mile from Portland Maine Mall. Guests enjoy comfortable guest rooms, free high speed internet and complimentary hot break buffet during every stay at our South Portland hotel. Between 4:30pm and 7pm daily, join us in the lobby for an evening reception featuring light fare and non-alcholic beverages. We provide complimentary roundtrip airport transportation from 3:30am to 12am. Visit us in the warmer months and enjoy the only heated outdoor pool in the area.
